currentLevel.title: Sort Equity and Liabilities
currentLevel.description: Sort each item into the correct category: Equity or Liabilities. There are no assets in this level.

gameData.scene: A busy lemonade stand with a financial workspace where you need to organize your business records.
gameData.prompt: Now that your lemonade stand is running, it's time to organize your finances! Sort each item into the correct category: Equity or Liabilities.
hints: Equity represents the owner's claims on the business.
Liabilities are what the business owes to others.

items.name: Owner's Investment
items.description: Money put into the business by the owner

items.name: Bank Loan
items.description: Money borrowed from the bank that must be repaid

items.name: Retained Earnings
items.description: Profits kept in the business instead of being paid out

items.name: Accounts Payable
items.description: Money owed to suppliers for goods or services

items.name: Piggy Bank Savings
items.description: Your own saved allowance money you put into the business

items.name: Loan from Parents
items.description: Money borrowed from mom and dad that you need to pay back

items.name: Birthday Money
items.description: Gift money from your birthday that you invested in the stand

items.name: Friend's Loan
items.description: Money your best friend lent you for supplies

items.name: Chore Money
items.description: Money you earned from doing extra chores at home

items.name: Store Credit
items.description: Supplies you got from the store but haven't paid for yet

items.name: Lemonade Profits
items.description: Money you made from selling lemonade that you kept in the business

items.name: Neighbor's Advance
items.description: Your neighbor paid you early for next week's lemonade delivery

data.submitPrompt: Submit your answers when all items are sorted.
data.successMessage: Great job! You've correctly sorted equity and liabilities.
data.failureMessage: Try again! Make sure each item is in the correct category.
